content.description: Cyclin-dependent kinase <math alttext="7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn></math> (<math alttext="C D K 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CDK</mi><mn>7</mn></math>) binds to cyclin <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math> and a second accessory protein, <math alttext="M A T 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>MAT</mi><mn>1</mn></math>, to form a complex of three proteins. Researchers investigating the role of <math alttext="C D K 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CDK</mi><mn>7</mn></math> claim that formation of this complex promotes cell cycle progression.
content.question: Which of the following supports the researchersâ€™ claim?

choices.label: Decreased expression of <math alttext="C D K 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CDK</mi><mn>7</mn></math> initiates <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> replication.
Decreased expression of <math alttext="C D K 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CDK</mi><mn>7</mn></math> results in the formation of spindle fibers.

Increased expression of <math alttext="C D K 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CDK</mi><mn>7</mn></math> causes cells to enter <math alttext="G 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>G</mtext><mn>0</mn></msub></math>.
Increased expression of <math alttext="C D K 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CDK</mi><mn>7</mn></math> is associated with certain types of cancer.

content.answer: Increased expression of <math alttext="C D K 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CDK</mi><mn>7</mn></math> is associated with certain types of cancer.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
